objects.description:
This test case was created for Bug 869259 https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=869259

Prerequisites: Pair a second device to the test device using a Bluetooth connection
objects.name: [Bluetooth] File transfer is completed before enabling USB storage

steps.expected: A dialog is displayed containing the file name, the device from which the transfer has been initiated, Yes and No option
steps.instruction: From a second device, send a file via Bluetooth to the test device.

steps.expected: The file transfer is started.
steps.instruction: Choose Yes.

steps.expected: The option is checked and says "Enabled". The test device is not actually connected to the laptop via USB.
steps.instruction: On the test device, plug in a USB cable and connect to a laptop. On the test device, go to Settings and check "Enable USB storage".

steps.expected: The bluetooth file transfer continues without interruption. As soon as the file transfer is complete, the test device enables USB connection to the laptop.
steps.instruction: On the test device, go to Notification Center Settings and check the status of the bluetooth file transfer.

objects.description:
Test case created for Bug 874155 https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=874155

Prerequisites:
3 phones with SIM Cards and SMS package enabled are needed. On the first 2 phones, store the number of the other phone under the name of a contact. For example,
John Doe 26853793 on phone #1 when the number of phone #2 is 26853793. 
Jane Doe 53934783 on phone #2 when the number of phone #1 is 53934783.
Send messages back and forth between the 2 contacts using the phones.
objects.name: Edit Mode UI is updated when receiving messages from the same number

steps.expected: The messaging (SMS) app is launched. The Messages screen is displayed with the name of the contact, the timestamp of the last message received and the first few characters of the last message received.
steps.instruction: On the B2G phone home screen, tap on the messages icon to launch the messaging (SMS) app.

steps.expected: The Contact screen is displayed with the contact name at the top, the phone number type and phone number below. Also displayed are the timestamp of the last message received and all the messages exchanged with the contact.
steps.instruction: On the Messages screen, tap on the contact name.

steps.expected: The Edit Messages screen  is displayed with all the messages having a check box in front of them. The Select all button is enabled. The Deselect all button is disabled.
steps.instruction: On the Contact screen, tap on the Edit icon in the top right hand corner.

steps.expected: All the messages are selected.  The Select all button is disabled. The Deselect all button is enabled.
steps.instruction: On the Edit Messages screen, tap on the Select all button.

steps.expected: The new incoming message is displayed on the Edit Messages screen and is not selected. The Select all button is enabled.  The Deselect all button is enabled.
steps.instruction: Using the same phone from which these messages have been received, send another message to this phone.

steps.expected: There is a notification about a new incoming message in the Notification Center. There is no change on the current Edit Messages screen.
steps.instruction: Using the 3rd phone, send a message to this phone.

steps.expected: The new message is displayed on a new screen with the number / contact name at the top and the message body below.
steps.instruction: Tap on the notification about the new incoming message.

objects.description:
As a user, I want to be able to switch my phone into Airplane mode, so that I can turn off all networks when I'm on a plane.

steps.expected: Verify Airplane Mode option becomes checked and the icon for Airplane Mode appears in the tool tray and that all other forms of data communication (wifi, bluetooth, GPS) all get disabled.

steps.expected: Verify the GPS option becomes checked.
steps.instruction: Tap the GPS option to enable it.

steps.expected: Verify Airplane Mode option becomes unchecked and the icon for Airplane Mode disappears from the tool tray and that all other forms of data communication (wifi, bluetooth, GPS) that were on prior to Airplane mode getting enabled all get renabled.

steps.expected: Verify the option is still able to be toggled and is not greyed out.

objects.description:
When returning to the Music App from another application, the play controls interface should display without error. The controls from another App's UI (Video App) should not cause the Music App's interface to break.

steps.expected: Music stops playing

steps.expected: Video starts playing

steps.expected: Video stops playing

steps.expected: List of active apps is shown

objects.description:
Test Case created for Bug 860605 https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=860605

#Prerequisites:  
#-An Email account with exactly 20 emails in it
objects.name: [EMAIL] First time Sync should take 2.5 seconds or less for 20 emails

steps.expected: The E-Mail app launches.
steps.instruction: On the B2G phone Home screen, tap on E-Mail icon.

steps.expected: The "Setting up account" message is displayed. On the Mail account setup screen, the "All done!" message is displayed. The email account is configured.
steps.instruction: On the New Account screen, configure an email account by entering the name, username, password, server settings, etc. Tap on the Next button.

steps.expected: The "Loading Messages" message is displayed. Then emails are synced from the mail server and are displayed.
steps.instruction: On the Mail account setup screen, tap on the Continue to Mail button. Start a timer.

steps.expected: Less than 2.5 seconds should have elapsed.
steps.instruction: Stop the timer.

objects.description:

Automated.  See bug 1110158

tags.description:
If this is the "Keyboard" test suite, you should have the "UI Test App".  Install it as follows:

1. Connect to the internet on your phone via WiFi or Data. 
2. Go to http://mozqa.com/webapi-permissions-tests/ in your B2G Browser.
3. scroll down to "Packaged App Test Case 13"
4. Click "Install Packaged App" button on the page.
5. The "UI Test" app should appear on your homescreen.

(Please disregard this step if this is "Keyboard & Text Handling" or any other suite).
tags.name: keyboard

steps.instruction: Open the Camera App

steps.expected: Photo is taken and then can be viewed by clicking on the preview icon at the bottom.

steps.expected: Captured photo is displayed in a larger view
steps.instruction: Tap the captured photo's preview icon

steps.expected: Toolbar icons are visible and clear
steps.instruction: View toolbar at the top of the screen

objects.description:
As a user, when tapping on a URL in the body of an email, a browse to URL overlay screen should appear to allow me to confirm leaving the Email app.

Prerequisites:
#a. An email account needs to be set up on the device prior to running this case.
objects.name: [Email] Long URL links tapped on in the body of an email, appear wordwrapped on the Browse to URL overlay screen

steps.expected: Verify that the email is sent successfully.
steps.instruction: From a second device, send an email that has a long URL link in the body to the test device.

steps.expected: Verify that the email was received successfully.
steps.instruction: Launch the Email app on the test device.

steps.expected: Verify that an overlay screen appears asking the user to confirm browsing to the URL.
steps.instruction: Open the email and tap on the long URL link in the body of the email.

steps.expected: Verify the long URL link is word wrapped on this screen and does not leave the screen because of the length.
steps.instruction: Observe the URL link that appears in the confirmation screen.

objects.description:
In the SMS thread view, when tapping on the highlighted URL the Browser APP is opened with a new tab where the URL is the one contained in the message. So, it's no necessary to remember the URL to manually enter in the browser.

Prerequisites:
#a. Data or Wifi is enabled and the Browser is closed (not even in background)
objects.name: [SMS] When tapping on a highlighted URL in a message that starts capitalized, then the browser is opened with the selected URL (Http://)

steps.expected: Verify the sms has been sent successfully to the test device.
steps.instruction: With a second device, send a sms message to the test device that contains a URL that starts with a capital letter. (Https://bugzilla.mozilla.org)

steps.expected: Verify that the user received the sms message successfully.
steps.instruction: Launch the SMS app with the test device.

steps.expected: Verify tapping on (Https://bugzilla.mozilla.org) opens the browser successfully to the appropriate link.
steps.instruction: Tap on the URL sent in the sms message that starts with Http://.

objects.description: The device is able to install and run a 3rd party application without the application slowing down or hanging.
objects.name: Verify that 3rd party games can be played without slow down and hangs.

steps.instruction: Open the Marketplace App

steps.expected: Keyboard is displayed
steps.instruction: Tap on the Search field

steps.expected: The 3rd party app "Poppit!" is displayed
steps.instruction: Type in: "Poppit" >Press Enter to conduct search

steps.expected: Application downloads
steps.instruction: Tap on the "Free" box

steps.expected: Application installs in the background
steps.instruction: Press the "Install" button when prompted

steps.expected: The 3rd party app opens and the game is playable
steps.instruction: Press the Home key>Navigate to the Poppit! icon>Tap on the Poppit! icon

steps.expected: The 3rd party app continues to operate at a normal and smooth rate
steps.instruction: Play the game normally for 2-3 minutes observing the game speed and fluidity

objects.description:
As a user, I want to see correct album art for any songs that contain the album art in the ID3 tag.

Prerequisites:
#a.  Have at least one song on the phone device that contains actual album art specific for that album.

objects.description: If the user is viewing a dialog prompt brought up by either system update, geo location or other things that bring up the same kind of prompt, then the user will be able to press the home button will cause the prompt to act like the prompt was canceled.
objects.name: Verify the user can press the Home button when System Update prompt is displayed.

steps.instruction: Open the Settings app.
Tap on Device Information.

steps.expected: The status bar will display a system update.
steps.instruction: Tap on Check now, under Software updates
Drag down the Notification bar and tap on "Updates Available"
Deselect any other updates and download the system update

steps.expected: The user will go back to whichever app the user was in when the prompt came up.
steps.instruction: Press the Home button when the install prompt is displayed.

objects.description:
The user will be able to create an SSID/ password with special characters.

https://moztrap.mozilla.org/manage/case/8752/
objects.name: Verify having an SSID/ Password with special characters is handled gracefully.

steps.instruction: Open the settings app.
Tap on Internet Sharing
Tap on Hotspot settings
Create an SSID and password as asdf"fdsa
Save the settings and toggle the Wi-Fi hotspot.

steps.expected: The user will be able to connect to the device with valid credentials.
steps.instruction: Have a second device try to connect to the first device.

objects.description:
Test case was created for Bug 869903 https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=869903

Prerequisites:
Load the SD Card of the B2G phone with a large number of images (roughly 3000).

objects.description: In the Network Settings menu, viewing the network type selector in another language should translate the word "Automatic" correctly.

Press Back once to return to the main Settings menu

steps.instruction: Selecct "Celular e Dados">Select "Operadora de rede"

objects.description:
While sending a photo file through the Gallery App, the device should now wait on a blank screen while waiting for the other device to accept or deny the transfer. 

#Pre-Requisites: Have an additional device capable of receiving Bluetooth files. Pair the Device Under Test with the additional device.

steps.expected: Bluetooth transfer recipient list is diplayed
steps.instruction: Tap a Photo>Tap the Share button>Select Bluetooth Transfer

steps.expected: While the other device received a deny/accept bluetooth transfer message, the Device Under Test returns to the photo selected in the Gallery
steps.instruction: Select a paired device>Select OK

objects.description:

objects.description:
While creating a new Calendar Event while in the Spanish language, the dates displayed should be in the "DD-MM-YYYY" time format. 

#Pre-requisites: Set Language to Spanish (Settings>Language>Espanol)

steps.expected: The date is displayed in the following time format: DD-MM-YYYY

objects.description: As a user in the Calendar app, when a I create a default alarm with a specific trigger time, then when I create a new event, and choose default alarm, the new alarm default should be used for that event.
objects.name: [Calendar] Creating a default alarm in calendar then creating a new event should use the default alarm

steps.instruction: Launch the Calender app.

steps.expected: Verify the main calender slides away revealing the calendars list
steps.instruction: Access the calendar list by tapping the Calendars button in the top left corner of the screen.

steps.expected: Verify that the user sees a list of calendar options.
steps.instruction: Tap the gear icon in the bottom left corner to bring up the Calendar settings screen.

steps.expected: Verify a list appears of the different event reminder times.
steps.instruction: Tap on the Events drop down list under the Reminders section.

steps.expected: Verify the 30 minute option now has a check mark next it to indicate it's selected.
steps.instruction: Select the 30 minute option and tap OK
Tap done and go back to the main calendar screen.

steps.expected: Verify that on the new Event page that the new default time for the reminder is the time that was selected in the options. (30 minutes)
steps.instruction: Tap the + icon in the top of the screen to create a new event.

objects.description:
When the SD card is removed from the device during the video playback of a file on the internal storage, the Video Player and MediaServer processes will close.

#Pre-Requisites: Device has video files stored internally on the device

steps.instruction: With SD Card removed>Open the Video App

steps.expected: Video begins to play
steps.instruction: Tap on a video to start playback

steps.expected: Video playback stops and Video Player closes when the SD card is removed. The user is returned to the Video Player's file browser
steps.instruction: While the video is playing, insert a SD card into the device. Then remove the SD card while the video is still playing. (If removing the battery is necessary, keep the phone plugged into a power supply)

objects.description:
When the Video App is loaded with 40 or more video files from the device's internal storage, the ability to scroll through the menu remains smooth and responsive.

steps.expected: Scrolling remains smooth and responsive

steps.expected: Scrolling remains smooth and responsive
steps.instruction: Switch to Landscape View>Scroll up and down through the entire menu

objects.description:
As a user, I want to add a new account choosing between: "Google", "Yahoo!", "CalDAV", "Offline Calendar" so that I can have access to all the email accounts that I use.

Prerequisites:
#a. Must have access to a Google account, a Yahoo account and a CalDav account.
objects.name: [Calendar] Tapping the Return button on the keyboard to set up calendar accounts functions the same as tapping the Done button

steps.instruction: Launch the Calendar app.

steps.expected: Verify the user is taken to the calendar accounts screen.
steps.instruction: Tap on the drawer in the upper left corner to navigate to the calendar accounts screen.

steps.expected: Verify the user sees options for creating a Google account, a Yahoo account and a CalDav account.
steps.instruction: Tap on the + button to open the Add an account screen.

steps.expected: Verify that the account is successfully added with no errors.
steps.instruction: Add a Google account with valid account information and tap the Return key on the keyboard instead of tapping DONE.

steps.expected: Verify that the account is successfully added with no errors.
steps.instruction: Next add a Yahoo account with valid account information and tap the Return key on the keyboard instead of tapping DONE.

steps.expected: Verify that the account is successfully added with no errors.
steps.instruction: Next add a CalDav account with valid account information and tap the Return key on the keyboard instead of tapping DONE.

objects.description:
The user is able to set HD wallpaper from the gallery app in both landscape and portrait modes. The quality of the wallpaper is not compromised.
 
Test case created for bug 883016 https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=883016

Prerequisites: Store two  high-resolution images (1920x1080) on the phone's SD Card.
objects.name: [Gallery] Setting HD wallpaper in portrait and landscape mode

steps.expected: The Gallery app launches, scans the SD Card for images and rearranges the thumbnails in portrait mode (normal mode)
steps.instruction: On the phone home screen, tap on the Gallery icon.

objects.description:
Test Case created for Bug 856542 https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=856542

Prerequisites: The SD Card should be loaded with 20+ videos of length from a few seconds to several minutes.
objects.name: [Video] Videos can play as soon as the Video app is launched for the first time

steps.expected: The Video app launches and displays thumbnails for videos found on scanning the SD Card.
steps.instruction: On the phone home screen, tap on the Video icon.

steps.expected: The video corresponding to the thumbnail starts playing.
steps.instruction: As soon as a single thumbnail is visible, tap on it. Do this while the Video app is still scanning and creating thumbnails.

steps.expected: The video moves forward and backward as desired.
steps.instruction: Use the controls at the bottom of the screen to move forward and backward in the video.

steps.expected: The Video app resumes scanning the SD Card and adding thumbnails.
steps.instruction: Tap to go back to the thumbnail view.

steps.expected: The video corresponding to the thumbnail starts playing. It can be moved forward and backward as desired.
steps.instruction: Tap on different thumbnails as they become visible, before the Video app has finished scanning the SD Card.

objects.description:
As a user, ending a video in landscape mode and returning to the Video List UI, the Video List should display the photo previews, video names, time stamps and video list options in landscape mode. 

#Pre-requisites: Have a video stored on the SD card or internal phone storage.
objects.name: [B2G Video] Verify that after a video in landscape mode ends that the Video List resumes normally

steps.instruction: Open the Video App

steps.expected: Video List UI displays photo previews, video names, time stamps and video list options in portrait mode.
steps.instruction: Hold the device in Portrait mode (vertical)

steps.expected: Video begins playing and switches to Landscape view
steps.instruction: Tap a Video>Rotate the screen to Landscape mode (horizontal)

steps.expected: The video returns to the beginning of the video in a stopped state.
steps.instruction: Allow video to reach it's ending point (scroll ahead if long video)

steps.expected: The Video List UI appears in Landscape view displaying photo previews, video names, time stamps and video list options.
steps.instruction: Return to the Video List UI while holding the device in landscape mode.

steps.expected: Video beings playing in Landscape view
steps.instruction: (Remain in Landscape view) Tap any video

steps.expected: The video ends and returns to the beginning of the video in a stopped state.
steps.instruction: Allow video to reach it's ending point (scroll ahead if long video)

steps.expected: The Video List UI appears correctly in landscape mode displaying photo previews, video names, time stamps and video list options.
steps.instruction: (Remain in Landscape view) Return to the Video List UI

objects.description:
On v1.1, mediaserver process handle following things. Some apps use mediaserver concurretly.
 - audio out, camera hw, video codec, audio codec
If mediaserver is killed because of music app, Other apps using mediaserver capability should not be affected.

#Prerequisite: Device has at least 1 mp3 audio file and 1 h.264 video file
objects.name: Test that ending the Music App's mediaserver process does not affect other mediaserver Apps

steps.instruction: Open the Music App

steps.expected: Music begins to play
steps.instruction: Find and play a MP3 audio file

steps.expected: Music continues to play
steps.instruction: Push the Home button
Open the Video App

steps.expected: Music stops playing. Video and corresponding audio begin playing
steps.instruction: Find and play a h.264 video file
Long press the Home button. Kill the Music app. (scroll to Music app and swipe app up off the screen)

steps.expected: Video and corresponding audio resume correctly
steps.instruction: Resume the Video App. Resume the video.

objects.description:
Prerequisite:
1. There is newer OTA update package available on Update URL.
2. Launch terminal in your linux computer
3. Follow below commands to download auto tools.
     - mkdir B2G-flash-tool
     - git clone https://github.com/Mozilla-TWQA/B2G-flash-tool.git
4. Please execute below steps to change  update URL in tty if need.
     - Make sure the current path location is under /B2G-flash-tool
     - Execute below command to change update URL
        -  ./change_OTA_URL.sh -u [update URL]
        Ex: ./change_OTA_URL.sh -u http://update.boot2gecko.org/helix/1.3.0/nightly/update_20140120004002.xml
objects.name: [OTA] Install OTA update package

steps.expected: The device can access network. And the update available notification display on screen.

steps.expected: There is system update in update list. After click Download, there is Downloading updates notification display on screen.
steps.instruction: Click the update available notification. Download it.

steps.expected: The device will install system update, then black screen and auto-restart.
steps.instruction: Click Install Now button after system update ready.

objects.description:
PREREQUISITES:
-----
DUT and device B powered on, with SIM card in, and enough mobile signal coverage.
------
User can chose to be informed about the delivey status of the SMS sent, and the correct icon apperars in the SMS thread view next each message successfully delivered
objects.name: User is informed about the successful delivery of a sent SMS when "Delivery reports" option is ON

steps.expected: Delivery reports option is now actived
steps.instruction: On the DUT, open Settings->Message settings, and toggle on the option "Delivery reports". Click on the "OK" upper right icon.

steps.expected: The SMS is received in device B
steps.instruction: Open SMS App. From DUT send  an SMS to device B (whose  phone number may be or not in the contact list)

steps.expected:
On the SMS thread view of the DUT, there is a  tick icon next to the message indicating it has been well delivered

Note: AT&T does not support this feature. Use T-mobile, or other carriers that support this feature to run this test case.
steps.instruction: On the DUT open the newly sent SMS thread view

objects.description:
PREREQUISITES:
-----
DUT and device B powered on, with SIM card in, and enough mobile signal coverage
-----
User can chose to be informed about the delivey status of the SMS sent, and the correct icon apperars in the SMS thread view next each message successfully delivered
objects.name: User is not informed about the successful delivery of a sent SMS when "Delivery reports" option is OFF

steps.expected: Delivery reports option is now disabled
steps.instruction: On the DUT, open Settings->Message settings, and toggle off the option "Delivery reports". Click on the "OK" upper right icon.

steps.expected: The SMS is received in device B
steps.instruction: Open SMS App. From DUT send  an SMS to device B (whose  phone number may be or not in the contact list)

steps.expected: On the SMS thread view of the DUT, there is no  tick icon next to the message indicating it has been well delivered
steps.instruction: On the DUT open the newly sent SMS thread view

objects.description:
PREREQUISITES:
-----
DUT and device B  with SIM card in, and enough mobile signal coverage
-----
The correct icon apperars in the SMS thread view next each message successfully delivered, though when sending the message the target device is powered off, and later powered on
objects.name: User is  informed about the successful delivery of a sent SMS when "Delivery reports" option is ON, though target device is first off, and then powered on

steps.expected: Delivery reports option is now active
steps.instruction: On the DUT, open Settings->Message settings, and toggle on the option "Delivery reports". Click on the "OK" upper right icon

steps.expected: The SMS is not received in device B and on the SMS thread view of the DUT, there is no tick icon next to the message indicating it has been well delivered
steps.instruction: Open SMS App. From DUT send  an SMS to device B (whose  phone number may be or not in the contact list) and device B must be powered off.

steps.expected: The SMS is received in device B
steps.instruction: Power on device B

steps.expected: On the SMS thread view of the DUT, there is a  tick icon next to the message indicating it has been well delivered
steps.instruction: On the DUT open the newly sent SMS thread view

objects.description:
PREREQUISITE:
-----
DUT,  device B and C  with SIM card in, and enough mobile signal coverage. DUT and  device B powered on and Device C powered off
-----
User can chose to be informed about the delivey status of the SMS sent, and the correct icon apperars in the SMS thread view next each message successfully delivered
objects.name: User is informed about the successful delivery of a multi recipient sent SMS when "Delivery reports" option is ON

steps.expected: Delivery reports option is now actived
steps.instruction: On the DUT, open Settings->Message settings, and toggle on the option "Delivery reports". Click on the "OK" upper right icon.

steps.expected: The SMS is received in device B and not received in device C (it is powered off)

steps.expected: On the SMS thread view of the DUT (to device C), there is no  tick icon next to the message indicating it has been well delivered
steps.instruction: On the DUT, open the newly sent SMS  thread view created (to contact C)

steps.expected: The SMS is received in device C

steps.expected: On the SMS thread view of the DUT, there is a  tick icon next to the message indicating it has been well delivered (to device C)
steps.instruction: On the DUT open the newly sent SMS  thread view created (to contact C)

objects.description:
User Story:
As a user I want to select a contact from the contact list and send to another device that is already paired via Bluetooth with the sending device.
As the sender if bluetooth is not switched on I want to be informed and given the option to switch on bluetooth on the device. After switching on bluetooh, I want to automatically return to the contact sending process.
As the sender, if I am not already paired with the receiving device, I want to be given the opportunity to pair. After pairing, I want to automatically return to the contact sending process.

Preconditions:
* Contact app is open
* Sending and receiving devices have BT capability 

Acceptance Criteria:
* user is informed of successful sending of contact
* any sending failure is presented to the user in a comprehensible message
objects.name: [Contacts] Send contact as a VCARD via bluetooth

steps.instruction: Launch Contacts app
Select the Settings icon then Export Contacts

steps.expected: A list of contacts currently on the device appears
steps.instruction: Select Bluetooth

steps.expected: A notification to turn Bluetooth on is shown if it is currently off, otherwise a page showing available Bluetooth-enabled devices appears
steps.instruction: Select any number of contacts then tap Export

steps.expected: A file transfer request is received by the other device
steps.instruction: Select one of the devices on the list

steps.expected: The Vcard file for the contact(s) is received without errors
steps.instruction: On the other device, accept the contact share request

steps.expected: The Contacts app opens, and the imported contacts are added to the contact list
steps.instruction: Once the transfer completes, tap the notification

steps.expected: All of the contact's information is shown correctly
steps.instruction: Tap the imported contact

objects.description:
User Story:

As a user I want to be prompted if a different device tries to connect via BT and want to be able to pair with the device and then return to receiving the VCARD from the sending device.
As a user I want to be able to accept or reject a VCARD that is sent via BT to me. As a user I want the content of the VCARD to be stored in a way that contacts app can read and display the details in its app.

Preconditions:

* Receiving device has BT turned on
* Sending and receiving devices have BT capability
* Contacts app can read and store and display VCARD

Acceptance Criteria:

* If received file is not correct VCARD format then user must be informed of the issues
* User must be informed of a successful reception/storing of a VCARD
* User must be prompted in order to accept the reception of a VCARD
objects.name: [Contacts] Receive contact as a VCARD via bluetooth

steps.expected: A prompt pop-up on DuT
steps.instruction: Send VCARD information via BT from another device

steps.expected: receive the file successfully
steps.instruction: Accept the incoming file

steps.expected: Vcard info is complete without error
steps.instruction: Check if received VCard information in import to Contacts or not

objects.description:
User Story
As a user I expect to join up to 5 users into a conference call by making MO or MT calls. I expect to be able to put the conference call on hold while making or receiving a new call.
As a user, if I have 5 people on a conference call, I have to drop the conference call to be able to make an emergency call. If I dont have 5 people on a conference call, I want to be able to put the conference call on hold and make an emergency call when needed.
Preconditions:
* dialer app is open
* network supports up to 5 people on a conf call
Acceptance Criteria:
* user is informed if more than 5 people are attempted to be joined into a conf call of the max limit of 5
* user is informed that currently there is a conference call taking place on the dialer screen
* user is informed of any error situation in a comprehend-able message

steps.instruction: When launch a MO call

steps.expected: Then I can pick it up and join it to the conference call up to 5 people in the conference call
steps.instruction: When MT calls dials in to the DuT

objects.description:
User story:

As a conf call creator I expect the conf call to end when I hang up the call. And as a normal participant in a conference call I expect to hang up and the conf call not to end.

This user story should have already been implemented but included for completion and confirmation of functionality.

Preconditions:

* Dialer app is open
* a conference call is already ongoing


Acceptance Criteria:

* if conference call creator hangs up the call the conference call is ended without users getting any other special notification than the call ending
* if a participant in a conf call hangs up then the conference call continues without ans interruption
objects.name: [Dialer][Conference call] When a user who initiates a conference call hang the conference call off, the conference call ends

steps.expected: Then I can pick it up and join it to the conference call up to 5 people in the conference call
steps.instruction: When MT calls dials in to the DuT

steps.expected: The conference call ends. All the conference calls end
steps.instruction: When the conference call is ended by me

objects.description:
User story:

As a conf call creator I want to see who is currently on the conference call. This information can be either the matching contact name from the contacts app or if this is missing then the participants MSISDN.

As a participant of a call I am not able to see who else is on the conference call.


Preconditions:

* Dialer app is open
* conf call is currently taking place with at least 2 other participants

Acceptance Criteria:

* conf call creator can see on the screen name/MSISDN of participants
* if participant is hiding his/her number then the conf call creator should see that the participant is "unknown" 
* any other error messages should be displayed in a understandable message to the conf call creator.

steps.expected: Then call is made successfully
steps.instruction: When launch a MO call

steps.expected: Then I can pick it up and join it to the conference call up to 5 people in the conference call
steps.instruction: When MT calls dials in to the DuT

steps.expected: I can view the name/MSISDN of all participants of the call
steps.instruction: Check the screen

objects.description:
User story:

As a user I expect to be able to go into contacts app and select multiple/all contacts and export to my media card in VCARD format.

Preconditions:

* contacts app is open
* contacts are available in contacts app that can be exported to media card
* media card is present in the device

objects.description:
User Story:
As a user I want to select a contact from the contact list and send to another device that is already paired via Bluetooth with the sending device.
As the sender if bluetooth is not switched on I want to be informed and given the option to switch on bluetooth on the device. After switching on bluetooh, I want to automatically return to the contact sending process.
As the sender, if I am not already paired with the receiving device, I want to be given the opportunity to pair. After pairing, I want to automatically return to the contact sending process.

Preconditions:
* Contact app is open
* Sending and receiving devices have BT capability 

Acceptance Criteria:
* user is informed of successful sending of contact
* any sending failure is presented to the user in a comprehensible message
objects.name: [Contacts] Send contact as a VCARD via bluetooth and decline the request

steps.instruction: Launch Contacts app
Select on a exist contact

steps.expected: request made and there is a notification for the receiving device
steps.instruction: choose to share the contact info to connected BT device
Decline the contact share request

steps.expected: Vcard info is not sending to the connected device and the origin device shown the notification
steps.instruction: Check if the connected BT device receives the VCard or not

objects.description:
User Story:

As a user I want to be prompted if a different device tries to connect via BT and want to be able to pair with the device and then return to receiving the VCARD from the sending device.
As a user I want to be able to accept or reject a VCARD that is sent via BT to me. As a user I want the content of the VCARD to be stored in a way that contacts app can read and display the details in its app.

Preconditions:

* Receiving device has BT turned on
* Sending and receiving devices have BT capability
* Contacts app can read and store and display VCARD

Acceptance Criteria:

* If received file is not correct VCARD format then user must be informed of the issues
* User must be informed of a successful reception/storing of a VCARD
* User must be prompted in order to accept the reception of a VCARD
objects.name: [Contacts] Receive contact share request as a VCARD via bluetooth and reject it

steps.expected: A prompt pop-up on DuT
steps.instruction: Send VCARD information via BT from another device

steps.expected: nothing happend on DuT
steps.instruction: reject the incoming file

steps.expected: Vcard info doesn't been sent
steps.instruction: Check if received VCard information in import to Contacts or not

objects.description:
User should be able to camp on network with non-local carrier account/RUIM  when roaming preference setting is "Any".

Prerequisite:
1. For CDMA phone only.
2. Prepare 1 non-local CDMA carrier account or RUIM card.
3. Settings > Cellular & Data > Data roaming > Turn on.
objects.name: [Roaming Charge][CDMA] Verify roaming preference settings with non-local carrier account (data roaming enabled)

steps.expected: Device CANNOT camp on network. Data call is not connected neither.
steps.instruction: Insert non-local carrier RUIM card and set Settings > Cellular&Data > Network operator > Roaming preference to "Home".

steps.expected: Device can camp on network, and data call is connected.
steps.instruction: Set Settings > Cellular&Data > Network operator > Roaming preference to "Any".

steps.expected: Device CANNOT camp on network. Data call is not connected neither.
steps.instruction: Set roaming preference to "Home" again.

objects.description:
User all-day event reminder on device for 1 day displays as 15 hours on Google Calendar website 

#Prerequisite: User has Google Calendar account, User has enabled Google Calendar selecting drawer in upper left of device in Calendar App and tap to right of Google Calendar account to display blue check mark, Google calendar all-day event saved with no reminder set, Calendar in Month view on device
objects.name: [calendar] Verify user edit of Google Calendar All-day event alert for 1 day before  displays as 15 hours reminder on Google Calendar website

steps.expected: Calendar App opened
steps.instruction: Open Calendar App

steps.expected: Day selected highlighted in blue with event displayed in lower right of screen
steps.instruction: Tap on device the day with Google Calendar All-day event

steps.expected: Event displayed in full screen
steps.instruction: Tap event in lower right of screen

steps.expected: Edit event screen displays
steps.instruction: Tap Edit in upper right of screen

steps.expected: Remind me screen displays with list of options
steps.instruction: Tap button reading None - beneath text Remind me

steps.expected: 1 day before changes color (to blue) and blue checkmark displays to right
steps.instruction: Tap 1 day before

steps.expected: User returns to Edit Event screen with 1 day before displaying beneath the Remind me text
steps.instruction: Tap OK at bottom of screen

steps.expected: User returned to Month view Calendar screen - Event Edit updated on device
steps.instruction: Tap Done in upper right of screen

steps.expected: User logged into Google Calendar
steps.instruction: Log on to Google Calendar web site

steps.expected: Event displayed with reminder of 15 hours earlier
steps.instruction: Select All-day event that matches All-day event from device

objects.description:
As a user, anytime a missed call event occurs on the device, the user should receive a notification message as well as a notification in the notification center.

Prerequisites:
#a. Must have 1 contact in contacts that includes a phone number and can make a call to the test device.
#b. Test device must have lock screen enabled.
objects.name: Verify that in the event of a missed call from a known contact, notifications are displayed

steps.instruction: Lock the test device.

steps.expected: Verify that the test device starts ringing.
steps.instruction: With a second device which is a known contact, place a call to the test device and let it ring twice before ending the call.

steps.expected: Verify the user sees a missed call notification message and the known contacts info is shown.
steps.instruction: On the test device, observe the lock screen.

steps.expected: Verify the user sees the missed call event in the notification center and the known contacts info is shown.
steps.instruction: Unlock the test device and view the notification center pull down window.

steps.expected: Verify the user sees the missed call event from the known contact.
steps.instruction: Launch the Dialer app and navigate to the Missed Calls tab.

objects.description:
As a user, when I disable Data connection in Cellular and Data, if Data Roaming option was on, it should remain on.

*Please do not turn on the data connection during the FTE or the confirmation message will not appear when turning on the data connection.  See issue https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=923294
objects.name: Verify that in Settings, under Cellular and Data,Data Connection confirmation remains on if Data Roaming is canceled.

steps.instruction: Flash the test device.

steps.expected: Verify the user sees Cellular & Data options.
steps.instruction: Launch the Settings app and tap on Cellular & Data.

steps.expected: Verify Data Connection option gets enabled indicated by a checkmark.
steps.instruction: Tap on Data Connection to enable it.

steps.expected: Verify the user sees a message asking you to confirm turning Data Roaming on.
steps.instruction: Enable Data Roaming.

steps.expected: Verify that Data Roaming is still turned off but the Data Connection option remains enabled.
steps.instruction: Tap on Cancel for the confirmation message.

objects.description:
User should see notification when device receives a SI message.

Prerequisite:
Using NowSMS(http://www.nowsms.com/) to send WAP Push messages to device.
objects.name: [WAP Push] Notification of receiving a SI message

steps.instruction: Enable WAP Push in  Settings > Call setting.

steps.expected:
1. Audible notification sound will be heard. 
2. A WAP push message notification can be seen on lock screen.
steps.instruction: Send a WAP Push message from NowSMS with SI push type checked while device is screen off.

steps.expected: Notification can be seen on top bar. If notification is timeout, it can be seen after drag down notification tray.
steps.instruction: Unlock screen.

steps.expected:
1. Audible notification sound will be heard. 
2. A WAP push message notification can be seen on notification bar.
steps.instruction: Send a WAP Push message from NowSMS with SI push type checked while device is unlocked in idle mode.

steps.expected: The notification is in the tray.
steps.instruction: After notification bar is timeout, drag down notification tray.

objects.description:
User should see notifications when device receives SI messages.

Prerequisite:
Using NowSMS(http://www.nowsms.com/) to send WAP Push messages to device.
objects.name: [WAP Push] Notification of receiving multiple SI messages

steps.instruction: Enable WAP Push in Settings > Call setting.

steps.expected:
1. Audible notification sounds will be heard for each message.
2. WAP push message notifications can be seen on lock screen and able to scroll them on lock screen to view them all.
steps.instruction: Send more than three(as many as it can make scroll bar on lock screen appear) WAP Push message from NowSMS with SI push type and different URL for each while device is screen off.

steps.expected: Notification can be seen on top bar. If notification is timeout, unread message numbers are on top bar, and all message notifications can be seen after drag down notification tray.
steps.instruction: Unlock screen.

objects.description:
From bug 892164, this is for AVRCP (Audio / Video Remote Control Profile) 1.0 profile User Story BTP1: "User should be able to remotely control audio headphones, car audio systems, or stand-alone speaker units. (AVRCP 1.0 Profile) 1.0
—Basic remote control commands (play/pause/stop, etc.)"
objects.name: [Bluetooth] Music can be played and stopped remotely by user (DRAFT without UI stuffs)

steps.expected: Bluetooth Enabled and Connected
steps.instruction: Enable Bluetooth and connect to a bluetooth speaker/headphone

steps.expected: Music app opened up successfully
steps.instruction: Go to Music app

steps.expected: song plays and you can hear it from the phone
steps.instruction: Use bluetooth speaker/headphone to start to play a song

steps.expected: song stops and you can't hear it anymore
steps.instruction: Use bluetooth speaker/headphone to stop playing a song

steps.expected: Song plays as expected.
steps.instruction: Repeat Step 3, 4 for couple times

From bug 892164, this is for AVRCP 1.0 profile User Story BTP1: "User should be able to remotely control audio headphones, car audio systems, or stand-alone speaker units. (AVRCP 1.0 Profile) 1.0

From bug 892164, this is for AVRCP 1.0 profile User Story BTP1: "User should be able to remotely control audio headphones, car audio systems, or stand-alone speaker units. (AVRCP 1.0 Profile) 1.0

From bug 892165, this is for AVRCP 1.3 profile User Story BTP2:User should be able to remotely control audio headphones, car audio systems, or stand-alone speaker units. (AVRCP 1.3 Profile) 1.3 —all of 1.0 plus metadata and media-player state support

objects.description:
If a new SI message is received, identical SI-ID message on device will be replaced.

Prerequisite: Using NowSMS(http://www.nowsms.com/) to send WAP Push messages to device.
objects.name: [WAP Push] Receiving SI newer than received SI with identical SI-ID

steps.instruction: Enable WAP Push in Message settings.

steps.expected: Device will receive the message, do not read then close the message.
steps.instruction:
In NowSMS, select WAP Push Message, send a message with following settings:
Push Type: SI,
WAP URL: a linkable URL,
SI ID: ex:123,
SI Created: Set current date and time, ex: 2013-08-04T03:33:33Z

steps.expected: Device will receive the message and previous one will be discarded from notification bar.
steps.instruction:
Send another SI message with identical SI ID as above except:
WAP URL: a different linkable URL.
SI ID: ex:123,
SI Created: Set current date and time the same as last message, ex: 2013-08-04T03:33:33Z

steps.expected: Device will receive the message and previous one will be discarded from notification bar.
steps.instruction:
Send another SI message with identical SI ID as above except:
WAP URL: a different linkable URL.
SI ID: ex:123,
SI Created: Set current date and time later last message, ex: 2013-08-04T04:33:33Z

objects.description:
If an incoming SI message is older than another received SI message with identical SI-ID on device, the new one will not be shown on device.

Prerequisite: Using NowSMS(http://www.nowsms.com/) to send WAP Push messages to device.
objects.name: [WAP Push] Receiving SI older than other received SI with identical SI-ID

steps.instruction: Enable WAP Push in Settings > Call setting.

steps.expected: Device will receive the message, do not read then close the message.
steps.instruction:
In NowSMS, select WAP Push Message, send a message with following settings:
Push Type: SI,
WAP URL: a linkable URL,
SI ID: ex:456,
SI Created: Set current date and time, ex: 2013-08-04T03:33:33Z

steps.expected: Device will NOT receive the new message.
steps.instruction:
Send another SI message with identical SI ID as above except:
WAP URL: a different linkable URL.
SI ID: ex:456,
SI Created: Set current date and time earlier than last message, ex: 2013-08-04T02:33:33Z

objects.description:
Device should handle the expired SI message silently and discard it without notifying users.

Prerequisite: Using NowSMS(http://www.nowsms.com/) to send WAP Push messages to device.

steps.instruction: Enable WAP Push in Settings > Call setting.

steps.expected: Device will not receive the message.
steps.instruction: In NowSMS, select WAP Push Message, send a message with following settings: Push Type: SI, WAP URL: a linkable URL, SI Expires: Set the date and time that is earlier than current time, ex: 2013-08-04T03:33:33Z

objects.description:
SI message that is expired on device should be marked with "expired".

Prerequisite: Using NowSMS(http://www.nowsms.com/) to send WAP Push messages to device.
objects.name: [WAP Push] Handling expired SI message on device

steps.instruction: Enable WAP Push in Settings > Call setting.

steps.expected: Device will receive the message, do not close the message.
steps.instruction: In NowSMS, select WAP Push Message, send a message with following settings: Push Type: SI, WAP URL: a linkable URL, SI Expires: Set the date and time that is later than current time, ex: YYYY-MM-DDTxx:xx:xxZ
Adjust data and time on device that is even later than the expire time set on SI message.

steps.expected: It is marked as "expired".
steps.instruction: Go to notification bar to check the SI again.

objects.description:

SI ID: abc1

steps.expected: CB can be received on DUT and read.

User should not be able to receive cell broadcast message when CB is disabled on device.

On emulator only https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/FirefoxOS/UsingtheB2Gemulators

1) $git clone git://github.com/mozilla-b2g/B2G.git . 
2) $BRANCH=v2.x ./config.sh emulator 
3) $ ./build.sh 
4) $./run-emulator.sh 
5) Connect to the console of the emulator: $telnet localhost 5554 
6) Send a pdu (as follows ) to simulate sending a CBS message to to DUT
objects.name: Receiving Cell Broadcast message (CB is disabled)

steps.instruction: Disable CB under Settings > Messaging Settings

steps.expected: CB can NOT be received on DUT.

objects.description:
User should be able to receive cell broadcast message during voice call.

On emulator only https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/FirefoxOS/UsingtheB2Gemulators

1) $git clone git://github.com/mozilla-b2g/B2G.git . 
2) $BRANCH=v2.x ./config.sh emulator 
3) $ ./build.sh 
4) $./run-emulator.sh 
5) Connect to the console of the emulator: $telnet localhost 5554 
6) Send a pdu (as follows ) to simulate sending a CBS message to to DUT
objects.name: Receiving Cell Broadcast message during voice call

steps.instruction: Enable CB under Settings > Messaging Settings

steps.expected: Call is established.
steps.instruction: Make a originated call.

steps.expected:
1. CB can be received and read on DUT.
2. Voice call is not disconnected.

objects.description:
User should be able to receive cell broadcast message during data call transmitting.

On emulator only https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/FirefoxOS/UsingtheB2Gemulators

1) $git clone git://github.com/mozilla-b2g/B2G.git . 
2) $BRANCH=v2.x ./config.sh emulator 
3) $ ./build.sh 
4) $./run-emulator.sh 
5) Connect to the console of the emulator: $telnet localhost 5554 
6) Send a pdu (as follows ) to simulate sending a CBS message to to DUT
objects.name: Receiving Cell Broadcast message along with active data call

steps.instruction: Enable CB under Settings > Messaging Settings

steps.expected: Data call is active.
steps.instruction: Establish data call and download file.

steps.expected:
1. CB can be received and read on DUT.
2. Data call is not disconnected or download stopped.

objects.description:
Device cannot receive WAP Push message after disable it.

Prerequisite:
Using NowSMS(http://www.nowsms.com/) to send WAP Push messages to device.
objects.name: [WAP Push] Disable WAP Push message

steps.instruction: Disable WAP Push in Settings under Settings > Call Settings.

steps.expected: Device will NOT receive message.
steps.instruction: Send a WAP Push message from NowSMS with SI push type checked.

steps.expected: Device will NOT receive message.
steps.instruction: Send a WAP Push message from NowSMS with SL push type checked.

objects.description:
User should be able to enable the preferred voice mode in CDMA network.

Prerequisite: For CDMA phone only.
objects.name: [CDMA] Enable voice privacy mode

steps.instruction: Enable voice  privacy mode in Settings > Call setting and press ok button.

steps.expected: Voice privacy is enabled.
steps.instruction: Exit the setting and go back to Call setting again.
Reboot device.

steps.expected: Voice privacy is enabled.
steps.instruction: Go to Call setting.

objects.description:
User should be able to disable the preferred voice mode in CDMA network.

Prerequisite: For CDMA phone only.
objects.name: [CDMA] Disable voice privacy mode

steps.instruction: Disable voice  privacy mode in Settings > Call setting and press ok button.

steps.expected: Voice privacy is disabled.
steps.instruction: Exit setting and go to Call setting again.
Reboot device.

steps.expected: Voice privacy is disabled.
steps.instruction: Go to Call setting.

objects.description:
User should be able to select long DTMF tone type.

Prerequisite: For CDMA phone only.
objects.name: [CDMA] User should be able to set the type of DTMF tone to long

steps.expected: There are long and short items in it, with either one is checked.
steps.instruction: Go to Settings > Sound > Audible touch tones.
Select type to long.

steps.expected: Call is connected.
steps.instruction: Dial out to another phone.

steps.expected: DTMF tone will sound as long as user presses until release the button on both DUT and remote party.
steps.instruction: Go to Dialer, press the keys on keypad.

objects.description:
User should be able to select short DTMF tone type.

Prerequisite: For CDMA phone only.
objects.name: [CDMA] User should be able to set the type of DTMF tone to short

steps.expected: There are long and short items in it, with either one is checked.
steps.instruction: Go to Settings > Sound > Audible touch tones.
Select type to short.

steps.expected: Call is connected.
steps.instruction: Dial out to another phone.

steps.expected: DTMF tone only sound for a short time (ex:120 ms) on both DUT and remote party even user doesn't release the button.
steps.instruction: Go to Dialer, press the keys on keypad.

objects.description:
User can interact IVR system with either short or long DTMF tone type.

Prerequisite: For CDMA phone only.
objects.name: [CDMA] Navigating IVR(interactive voice response) system with DTMF

steps.expected: There are long and short items in it, with either one is checked.
steps.instruction: Go to Settings > Sound > Audible touch tones.
Select type to long.
Go to Dialer, dial a call to an IVR system of your CDMA account carrier, ex: 999 for APTG, (800)922-0204 for Verizon.

steps.expected: IVR system can recognize the key and being navigated correctly.
steps.instruction: Follow the voice instruction and dial the corresponding key on dialer.

steps.expected: If IVR can recognize the key, it will execute correct action. Otherwise change the tone to long type and make sure same IVR can recognize it.
steps.instruction: Repeat above step with short tone type.

objects.description:
As a user, when attaching a file above 20MiB in size or multiple smaller files that add up to over 20MiB, I want to see a clear message stating why the files cannot be attached and sent through email.

Prerequisites:
#a. User must have Email set up on the test device.
#b. User must have a file 20MiB or greater in size on the test device.
objects.name: Verify the user receives an error when attaching a single file that exceeds 5mb in size to an email.

steps.expected: Verify the Email app launches.
steps.instruction: Launch the Email app.

steps.expected: Verify the user sees a blank email ready for composing.
steps.instruction: Tap the compose new email button in the top right corner of the screen.

steps.expected: Verify the user now sees a list of options to include files from. (Wallpaper, Gallery, Camera and Cancel)
steps.instruction: Tap the paperclip icon at the top of the screen.

steps.expected: Verify the user receives an error that states that the file is too large to be attached.
steps.instruction: Tap on the application that includes the large file and attempt to attach it to the email.

objects.description:
When a user searches for a video with a length of below 10 minutes, then the user will be able to watch the video without any issues.

Prerequisite:
Have a data connection
objects.name: Verify watching a Youtube video lower than 10 minutes works properly

steps.instruction: Tap on the Rocketbar
type: www.youtube.com
Search for a video with a length under 10 minuites

steps.expected: The video is playable all the way through without issues.
steps.instruction: Play the video

objects.description:
When a user searches for a video with a length of more than 10 minutes, then the user will be able to watch the video without any issues.

Prerequisite:
Have a data connection
objects.name: Verify watching a Youtube video above 10 minutes works properly

steps.instruction: tap on the rocketbar
type: www.youtube.com
Search for a video with a length above 10 minuites

steps.expected: The video is playable all the way through without issues.
steps.instruction: Play the video

objects.description:
As a user, when attaching a file above 20MiB in size or multiple smaller files that add up to over 20MiB, I want to see a clear message stating why the files cannot be attached and sent through email.

Prerequisites:
a. User must have Email set up on the test device.
b. User must have several files that add up to 20MiB in size on the test device.
objects.name: Verify the user receives an error when attaching multiple files that exceed 5mb in size to an email.

steps.expected: Verify the Email app launches.
steps.instruction: Launch the Email app.

steps.expected: Verify the user sees a blank email ready for composing.
steps.instruction: Tap the compose new email button in the top right corner of the screen.

steps.expected: Verify the user now sees a list of options to include files from. (Wallpaper, Gallery, Camera and Cancel)
steps.instruction: Tap the paperclip icon at the top of the screen.

steps.expected: Verify the user receives an error that states that the attached files are too large to be attached. The user should be able to then cancel the last file they tried to attach and try another or cancel and go back to the email.
steps.instruction: Add files from the available sources until you reach 20MiB in size.

objects.description: As a user, I want to be able to individually pick and choose which content to save to my device so that I can save only the files that I need.
objects.name: Verify that the user can save content received in an MMS

steps.expected: Verify the MMS is sent and received by the test device.
steps.instruction: From a second device, send an MMS containing an image to the test device.

steps.expected: Verify the user sees the message from the sending device.
steps.instruction: On the test device, launch the Messaging app.

steps.expected: Verify the user can see the image sent in the message.
steps.instruction: Tap on the received message.

steps.expected: Verify the user sees the image in a larger view and a Save button.
steps.instruction: Tap on the image

steps.expected: Verify the user is informed that the image has been saved.
steps.instruction: Tap the Save button.

steps.expected: Verify the saved content exists in the Gallery.
steps.instruction: Launch the gallery app.

objects.description:
User can sync newest emails to device and emails appear on screen in chronological order (newest to oldest) top to bottom with the number of new emails indicator briefly appearing on screen beneath the Orange Header labeled Inbox

#Prerequisites: Email account set up on the device, Have access to an external email account to send emails to email account on device, Have old emails in the inbox of the email account on the device
objects.name: [Email]Verify user can select Refresh softkey and view newest emails at top of device screen

steps.expected: Email App opens
steps.instruction: Open Email App

steps.expected: Email sent to account on device
steps.instruction: From external email account, type email to email address on device and press send

steps.expected: Screen on device shows new emails at top of the email list (newest at top). Below Inbox orange header, blue banner displays the number of new messages briefly and vanishes
steps.instruction: Tap Refresh softkey in lower left of screen on device

steps.expected: Screen moves down and older email messages are displayed (oldest at bottom).
steps.instruction: Swipe device up

objects.description:
As a user, when I turn off Automatic selection in Settings -> Cellular & Data -> Network Operator, then the underlying text under Automatic Selection should read Manual not Automatic.

Prerequisites:
#a. Must have a Sim card in the device.
objects.name: Verify that by turning off Automatic Selection in Network Operator for Cellular & Data, that the state now reads Manual

steps.instruction: Launch the Settings app.

steps.expected: Verify the user sees the option for Automatic Selection and it's On by default. Notice that when the option is on, the state text underneath the option says Automatic.
steps.instruction: Navigate to Cellular & Data and select Network Operator.

steps.expected: Verify the state text under Automatic Selection now says Manual indicating the user can now select their own Network Operator.
steps.instruction: Tap on the On/Off Selector switch for Automatic Selection.

objects.description:
As a user, I would like to be able to specify the synchronization frequency when setting up an email account and from within the email settings to chose how often synchronization occurs to help save on battery life and so that I am notified of emails in a timely fashion.

@ Precondition: 
1) Prepare a FxOS device, we called Phone-A
2) Prepare an email account, we called emailacc-1, emailacc-1
3) No email account is set into email app.
objects.name: [Email][Notification] Synchronization frequency: Default value is "Manually"

steps.expected: After that, the email app is launched
steps.instruction: Tapping the email icon

Input account information(emailacc-1) on account creating page.
1) Your name
2) E-mail
3) Password

While you are done, tap the "Next" button of the upper right corner.

steps.expected: The default value of "Check for new message" is "Manually"
steps.instruction: After you entered the next page, please check the default value of "Check for new message"
Stay on locked homescreen

steps.expected: If the "Check for new message"="Manually", the FxOS don't have any notifications or emails appear.
steps.instruction: Complete the setup of email account.

objects.description:
As a user, I would like to be able to specify the synchronization frequency when setting up an email account and from within the email settings to chose how often synchronization occurs to help save on battery life and so that I am notified of emails in a timely fashion.

@ Precondition: 
1) Prepare a FxOS device, we called Phone-A

2) Prepare an email account, we called emailacc-1, emailacc-1

3) No email account is set into email app.
objects.name: [Email][Notification] Synchronization frequency: 5 minutes

steps.expected: After that, the email app is launched
steps.instruction: Tapping the email icon

Input account information(emailacc-1) on account creating page.
1) Your name
2) E-mail
3) Password

While you are done, tap the "Next" button of the upper right corner.

steps.expected: The e-mail account is set.
steps.instruction:
After you entered the next page, set the following information.
1) Check for new messages="5 minutes"
2) Display notifications for new messages="Enable"

Then tap the "Next" button of the upper right corner.
Stay on locked homescreen

steps.expected:
The notification pop up within 5 minutes and the notification includes following information.

1. User receive a notification after 5 minutes

2. The first line displays subject n bold.

3. The second line displays sender's name

As attachment.
steps.instruction: Send a email to the email account that we set up
