objects.description:
User can see 1x icon on status bar when device is connected to CDMA 1x network.

Prerequisite:
1. For CDMA phone only, make sure you have CDMA account and test under CDMA network.
2. Set Settings > Cellular & Data > Network operator > Network type > choose "CDMA".
objects.name: [CDMA] Verify status bar for connection using 1xRTT data call

steps.expected: 1x icon will be on status bar.
steps.instruction: Establish data call.

steps.expected: 1x icon will not be on status bar, only signal level bar.
steps.instruction: Disconnect data call.

objects.description:
User can see Ev icon on status bar when device is connected to CDMA EVDO network.

Prerequisite:
1. For CDMA phone only, make sure you have CDMA account and test under CDMA network.
2. Set Settings > Cellular & Data > Network operator > Network type > choose "EVDO".
objects.name: [CDMA] Verify status bar for connection using EVDO data call

steps.expected: Ev icon will be on status bar.
steps.instruction: Establish data call.

steps.expected: Ev icon will not be on status bar, only signal level bar.
steps.instruction: Disconnect data call.

objects.description:
User can know the 1x signal strength by reading signal bar. Since different carriers may have varied level display rules and will modify the code to comply it, the purpose of this test is to make sure level bar can be changed based on Rx power it receives, not focusing on detail display level compared with received signal dBm. 

Prerequisite:
1. For CDMA phone only, make sure you have CDMA account and test under CDMA network.
2. Set Settings > Cellular & Data > Network operator > Network type > choose  "CDMA only".
objects.name: [CDMA] Verify signal level for connection using CDMA 1x network

steps.expected: 1x icon will be on status bar.
steps.instruction: Establish data call.

steps.expected: Signal level bar will be changed.
steps.instruction: Take device to weaker signal area and monitor the signal level bar.

steps.expected: Signal level bar will be changed.
steps.instruction: Repeat step 2 with voice call connected.

objects.description:
User can know the EVDO signal strength by reading signal bar. Since different carriers may have varied level display rules and will modify the code to comply it, the purpose of this test is to make sure level bar can be changed based on Rx power it receives, not focusing on detail display level compared with received signal dBm. 

Prerequisite:
1. For CDMA phone only, make sure you have CDMA account and test under CDMA network.
2. Set Settings > Cellular & Data > Network operator > Network type > choose "EVDO"
objects.name: [CDMA] Verify signal level for connection using EVDO network

steps.expected: Ev icon will be on status bar.
steps.instruction: Establish data call.

steps.expected: Signal level bar will be changed.
steps.instruction: Take device to weaker signal area, monitor the signal level bar.

objects.description:
Users will be able to listen to Amr audio files.

Prerequisite:
Have an Amr audio file
objects.name: Verify the user can play Amr files

steps.expected: The music app will be opened.
steps.instruction: Open the Music app

steps.expected: The song is listed and playable.
steps.instruction: Select the Amr music file located in the list of songs.

objects.description:
When device is in no service area, no level will be seen on signal bar.

Prerequisite:
1. For CDMA phone only, make sure you have CDMA account and test under CDMA network.
2. Test may need a no service environment such as shielding room, box and bag or an area.
objects.name: [CDMA] Verify signal level for no service condition

steps.expected: 1x or EV icon will be on status bar depends on the network status.
steps.instruction: Establish data call.

steps.expected: Signal level bar will have no level at all and data call icon will be gone.
steps.instruction: Take device to no service environment.

objects.description:
When there is no signal, device cannot make originated or terminated voice calls.

Prerequisite: 
1. For CDMA phone only, make sure you have CDMA account under CDMA network.
2. Test may require no service environment such as shielding box, bag or room or a no signal area.
objects.name: [CDMA] MT/MO voice call under no service condition

steps.expected: No signal level can be seen on status bar.
steps.instruction: Take device to no service environment.

steps.expected: Unable to dial out the call along with an warning message indicating network is needed first.
steps.instruction: MO a call from DUT.

steps.expected: Unable to dial out the call along with an warning message indicating network is needed first.
steps.instruction: MT a call to DUT.

objects.description:
When there is no signal, device cannot access data call.

Prerequisite: 
1. For CDMA phone only, make sure you have CDMA account under CDMA network.
2. Test may require no service environment such as shielding box, bag or room or a no signal area.
objects.name: [CDMA] Using data call under no service condition

steps.expected: No signal level can be seen on status bar.
steps.instruction: Take device to no service environment.

steps.expected: No 1x or Ev icon shown on status bar.
steps.instruction: Enable data call from Settings.

steps.expected: Unable to load the data from those apps.
steps.instruction: Open apps that require data connection, ex: browse a website, marketplace.

steps.expected: Data call icon is shown and data call is working.
steps.instruction: Return to area with network coverage.

objects.description:
User can make device enter ECM mode after dial out an emergency call.

Prerequisite:
1. For CDMA phone only, make sure you have CDMA account under CDMA network.
2. Emergency call number are varied in different country, please test with correct number for your local CDMA account.
objects.name: [CDMA] User can enter Emergency Callback Mode (ECM) on device

steps.instruction: Dial local emergency number from DUT. (ex: 911, 112)

steps.expected:
1. There is a notification underneath status bar to indicate emergency call back mode and the remaining time of it.  
2. Data is not connected.
steps.instruction: End the call when call is connected

objects.description:
Users can exit emergency callback mode after timout(Duration may be varied for different partners). 

Prerequisite:
1. For CDMA phone only, make sure you have CDMA account under CDMA network.
2. Emergency call number are varied in different country, please test with correct number for your local CDMA account.
objects.name: [CDMA] User can exit Emergency Callback Mode (ECM) after timeout

steps.expected: 1. There is a notification underneath status bar to indicate emergency call back mode and the remaining time of it. 2. Data will be disconnected.
steps.instruction: Dial local emergency number from DUT. (ex: 911, 112) End the call when call is connected.

steps.expected: ECM mode will be cancelled and call-out page shows.
steps.instruction: Wait for timer timeout.

steps.expected: Make sure data call can be accessed and SMS can be working now without being blocked by ECM mode.
steps.instruction: Checking data call and sending/receiving SMS.

objects.description:
User cannot use data call when device is in ECM. The purpose is allowed others can reach you through voice call.

Prerequisite:
1. For CDMA phone only, make sure you have CDMA account under CDMA network.
2. Emergency call number are varied in different country, please test with correct number for your local CDMA account.
objects.name: [CDMA] Unable to use data call when device is in Emergency Callback Mode (ECM)

steps.instruction: Enable data call.

steps.expected: 1. There is a notification underneath status bar to indicate emergency call back mode and the remaining time of it. 2. Data will be disconnected.
steps.instruction: Dial local emergency number from DUT. (ex: 911, 112) End the call when call is connected.

steps.expected: A confirm window pops out with description and countdown timer demonstrate ECM.
steps.instruction: Open Browser and try to load a website.

steps.expected: ECM is still there and keeping countdown. Website will not be loaded.
steps.instruction: Tap cancel button on the confirm window.

steps.expected: A confirm window pops out with description and countdown timer demonstrate ECM.
steps.instruction: Try to open other apps required data connection.

steps.expected: ECM is still there and keeping countdown. Apps cannot be loaded via data call.
steps.instruction: Tap cancel button on the confirm window.

objects.description:
User cannot  send and receive SMS when device is in ECM. The purpose is allowed others can reach you through voice call.

Prerequisite:
1. For CDMA phone only, make sure you have CDMA account under CDMA network.
2. Emergency call number are varied in different country, please test with correct number for your local CDMA account.
objects.name: [CDMA] Unable to send and receive SMS when device is in Emergency Callback Mode (ECM)

steps.expected: 1. There is a notification underneath status bar to indicate emergency call back mode and the remaining time of it. 2. Data will be disconnected.
steps.instruction: Dial local emergency number from DUT. (ex: 911, 112) End the call when call is connected.

steps.expected: A confirm window pops out with description and countdown timer demonstrate ECM.
steps.instruction: Send a SMS to other device.

steps.expected: Device is still in ECM with timer countdown.
steps.instruction: Tap cancel button on confirm window.

steps.expected: DUT will not receive the message.
steps.instruction: Send a SMS to DUT.

objects.description:
User can get MT call SMS when device is in ECM.

Prerequisite:
1. For CDMA phone only, make sure you have CDMA account under CDMA network.
2. Emergency call number are varied in different country, please test with correct number for your local CDMA account.
objects.name: [CDMA] User can receive voice call during Emergency Callback Mode (ECM)

steps.expected: 1. There is a notification underneath status bar to indicate emergency call back mode and the remaining time of it. 2. Data will be disconnected.
steps.instruction: Dial local emergency number from DUT. (ex: 911, 112) End the call when call is connected.

steps.expected: 1. Call can be answered on device. 2. If ECM is not timeout, ECM will not be terminated for the call or restart the counting.
steps.instruction: MT call to DUT.

objects.description:
User can see caller number and answer second incoming call.

Prerequisite:
1. For CDMA phone only, make sure you have CDMA account under CDMA network.
2. Please make sure CDMA test account has call waiting enabled. You can check with carrier for more detail of how to enable it.
objects.name: [CDMA][Call waiting] Answering the second incoming call (No contact)

steps.expected: Call is connected.
steps.instruction: Make a call to other device or MT a call to DUT

steps.expected: 1. Caller number of second incoming call is displayed on UI. 2. Audio indicator can be heard from receiver.
steps.instruction: MT a second call from non-contact caller to DUT.

steps.expected: 1. First call will be on hold. 2. There is a switch button on dialer.
steps.instruction: Answer the 2nd incoming call.

objects.description:
User can reject second incoming call.

Prerequisite:
1. For CDMA phone only, make sure you have CDMA account under CDMA network.
2. Please make sure CDMA test account has call waiting enabled. You can check with carrier for more detail of how to enable it.
objects.name: [CDMA][Call waiting] Rejecting the second incoming call

steps.expected: Call is connected.
steps.instruction: Make a call to other device or MT call to DUT.

steps.expected: 1. Second incoming call information is displayed on UI. 2. Audio indicator can be heard from receiver.
steps.instruction: MT a second call to DUT.

steps.expected: 1. Incoming call message will be off and back to previous caller information page. 2. First call is not on hold.
steps.instruction: Reject(Ignore) second incoming call.

objects.description:
User can switch two answered calls.

Prerequisite:
1. For CDMA phone only, make sure you have CDMA account under CDMA network.
2. Please make sure CDMA test account has call waiting enabled. You can check with carrier for more detail of how to enable it.
objects.name: [CDMA][Call waiting] Switching two calls

steps.expected: Call is connected.
steps.instruction: Make a call to other device or MT call to DUT.

steps.expected: 1. Second incoming call information is displayed on UI. 2. Audio indicator can be heard from receiver.
steps.instruction: MT a second call to DUT.

steps.expected: 1. First call will be on hold. 2. There is a switch button on dialer.
steps.instruction: Answer the 2nd incoming call.

steps.expected: The hold call will be active and able to communicate while original active on is on hold.
steps.instruction: Press "Switch" button.

steps.expected: Make sure there is no error and calls can be switched correctly.
steps.instruction: Switch calls above 5 times.

objects.description:
When two incoming calls are answered, ending the on-hold call from remote party will not impact existing active call.

Prerequisite:
1. For CDMA phone only, make sure you have CDMA account under CDMA network.
2. Please make sure CDMA test account has call waiting enabled. You can check with carrier for more detail of how to enable it.
objects.name: [CDMA][Call waiting] On-hold call is ended by remote party.

steps.expected: Call is connected.
steps.instruction: Make a call to other device or MT call to DUT.

steps.expected: 1. Second incoming call information is displayed on UI. 2. Audio indicator can be heard from receiver.
steps.instruction: MT a second call to DUT.

steps.expected: 1. First call will be on hold. 2. There is a switch button on dialer.
steps.instruction: Answer the 2nd incoming call.

steps.expected: 1. Due to CDMA limitation, switch button will remain on dialer. 2. Connection with active call is not disconnected and voice transmission is normal.
steps.instruction: End the call from originator which is on hold.

objects.description:
When two incoming calls are answered, on hold one will be reconnected when active one is ended from remote party.

Prerequisite:
1. For CDMA phone only, make sure you have CDMA account under CDMA network.
2. Please make sure CDMA test account has call waiting enabled. You can check with carrier for more detail of how to enable it.
objects.name: [CDMA][Call waiting] Active call is ended by remote party

steps.expected: Call is connected.
steps.instruction: Make a call to other device or MT call to DUT.

steps.expected: 1. Second incoming call information is displayed on UI. 2. Audio indicator can be heard from receiver.
steps.instruction: MT a second call to DUT.

steps.expected: 1. First call will be on hold. 2. There is a switch button on dialer.
steps.instruction: Answer the 2nd incoming call.

steps.expected: 1. Due to CDMA limitation, switch button will remain on dialer. 2. On hold call will be reconnected again and able to talk to each other.
steps.instruction: End the call from originator which is active mode with DUT.

objects.description:
Device can still pick up 3rd call after one of previous 2 calls is terminated.

Prerequisite:
1. For CDMA phone only, make sure you have CDMA account under CDMA network.
2. Please make sure CDMA test account has call waiting enabled. You can check with carrier for more detail of how to enable it.
objects.name: [CDMA][Call waiting] Answering third call when one of previous two calls is ended

steps.expected: Call is connected.
steps.instruction: Make a call to other device or MT call to DUT.

steps.expected: 1. Second incoming call information is displayed on UI. 2. Audio indicator can be heard from receiver.
steps.instruction: MT a second call to DUT.

steps.expected: 1. First call will be on hold. 2.There is a switch button on dialer.
steps.instruction: Answer the 2nd incoming call.

steps.expected: 1. Due to CDMA limitation, switch button will remain on dialer. 2. Connection with one remote party is remained.
steps.instruction: End the call from on of remote parties.

steps.expected: Incoming call information is displayed.
steps.instruction: MT call to DUT.

steps.expected: Switch button will show again and allow user to switch the calls.
steps.instruction: Answer the call.

objects.description:
When a user tries to pair with a device that requires a PIN, the prompt comes up and is then dismissed when the user taps on "Cancel" or "Pair".

Prerequisite:
Have a Bluetooth turned on
Have a Bluetooth device that requires a PIN to connect
objects.name: [Bluetooth] Verify the "Enter PIN" UI gets dismissed when taping "Pair"

steps.instruction: Open the Settings app
Navigate to Bluetooth

steps.expected: The device will be displayed in the list.
steps.instruction: Search for the Bluetooth device

steps.expected: The "Enter PIN" screen will be displayed.
steps.instruction: Tap on the Bluetooth device

steps.expected: The "Enter PIN" prompt will be dismissed and the user will be brought back to the list of devices.
steps.instruction: Tap on "Pair" after putting in the PIN

objects.description:

Navigate to Bluetooth

steps.instruction: Search for the Bluetooth device

steps.expected: The "Enter PIN" prompt will be dismissed and the user will be brought back to the list of devices.
steps.instruction: Tap on "Cancel"

objects.description:
User can use data call in 1xRTT network.

Prerequisite:
1. For CDMA phone only.
2. Make sure you have CDMA account.
3. Make sure you are in 1x and EVDO network coverage. (Or test with network emulator)
objects.name: [CDMA] Verify data call in "CDMA" only network mode

steps.instruction: Go to Settings > Cellular & Data > Network Operator > Network type.

steps.expected: 1x icon will be on status bar. No Ev icon even it's under EVDO network. 2.
steps.instruction: Select "CDMA".

steps.expected: Data call is working.
steps.instruction: Open apps required data access.

objects.description:
There must be a default checked item no matter it is "CDMA", "CDMA/EVDO ", or "EVDO", which indicates current network mode device is in.

Prerequisite:
1. For CDMA phone only.
2. Make sure you have CDMA account.
3. Make sure you are in 1xRTT and EVDO network coverage. (Or test with network emulator)
objects.name: [CDMA] Verify default mode in network mode setting

steps.expected: 1. There are at least "CDMA", "CDMA/EVDO", and "EVDO" items in the setting(depends on OEM design). 2. One of it is checked (depends on OEM design).
steps.instruction: Go to Settings > Cellular & Data > Network Operator > Network type.

objects.description:
User can use data call in either 1x or EV network based on network condition.

Prerequisite:
1. For CDMA phone only.
2. Make sure you have CDMA account.
3. Make sure you are in 1x and EVDO network coverage. (Or test with network emulator)
objects.name: [CDMA] Verify data call in CDMA/EVDO automatic network mode

steps.instruction: Go to Settings > Cellular & Data > Network Operator > Network type.

steps.expected: Ev icon will be on status bar. 1x icon will only be seen when entering area which only has 1x network.
steps.instruction: Select "CDMA/EVDO".

steps.expected: Data call is working.
steps.instruction: Open apps required data access.

objects.description:
User can use data call in EV network only even there is 1x network coverage by selecting "EVDO" in Network Type.

Prerequisite:
1. For CDMA phone only.
2. Make sure you have CDMA account.
3. Make sure you are in 1xRTT and EVDO network coverage. (Or test with network emulator)
objects.name: [CDMA] Verify data call in "EVDO" only network mode

steps.instruction: Go to Settings > Cellular & Data > Network Operator > Network type.

steps.expected: Ev icon will be on status bar.
steps.instruction: Select "EVDO".

steps.expected: Data call is working.
steps.instruction: Open apps that require data access.

objects.description:
Users can exit emergency callback mode from emergency notification.

Prerequisite:
1. For CDMA phone only, make sure you have CDMA account under CDMA network.
2. Emergency call number are varied in different country, please test with correct number for your local CDMA account.
objects.name: [CDMA] User can exit Emergency Callback Mode (ECM) from emergency notification

steps.expected: 1. There is a notification underneath status bar to indicate emergency call back mode and the remaining time of it. 2. Data will be disconnected.
steps.instruction: Dial local emergency number from DUT. (ex: 911, 112) End the call when call is connected.

steps.expected: A list will show emergency call back mode and the countdown timer.
steps.instruction: Scroll down the notification bar.

steps.expected: A confirm window pops out with description and countdown timer demonstrate ECM.
steps.instruction: Tap the list.

steps.expected: ECM mode will be cancelled and call-out page shows.
steps.instruction: Select ok on confirm window.

steps.expected: Make sure data call can be accessed and SMS can be working now without being blocked by ECM mode.
steps.instruction: Checking data call and sending/receiving SMS.

objects.description:
Users can exit emergency callback mode by dialing out a non-emergency call.

Prerequisite:
1. For CDMA phone only, make sure you have CDMA account under CDMA network.
2. Emergency call number are varied in different country, please test with correct number for your local CDMA account.
objects.name: [CDMA] User can exit Emergency Callback Mode (ECM) by dialing out a non-emergency call

steps.expected: 1. There is a notification underneath status bar to indicate emergency call back mode and the remaining time of it. 2. Data will be disconnected.
steps.instruction: Dial local emergency number from DUT. (ex: 911, 112) End the call when call is connected.

steps.expected: A confirm window pops out with description and countdown timer demonstrate ECM.
steps.instruction: Dial out a non-emergency number before ECM timeout.

steps.expected: ECM mode will be cancelled and call-out page shows.
steps.instruction: Select ok on the confirm window.

steps.expected: Make sure data call can be accessed and SMS can be working now without being blocked by ECM mode.
steps.instruction: Checking data call and sending/receiving SMS.

steps.instruction: Install a third party keyboard from Marketplace

tags.description:
If this is the "Keyboard" test suite, you should have the "UI Test App".  Install it as follows:

1. Connect to the internet on your phone via WiFi or Data. 
2. Go to http://mozqa.com/webapi-permissions-tests/ in your B2G Browser.
3. scroll down to "Packaged App Test Case 13"
4. Click "Install Packaged App" button on the page.
5. The "UI Test" app should appear on your homescreen.

(Please disregard this step if this is "Keyboard & Text Handling" or any other suite).
tags.name: keyboard

As a user, I want to be able to download and install third party keyboards, so that I can find an input solution that’s right for me.

* Note: If you need to test third party keyboard installation, you can use browser to open following hyperlink. This is a fake-keyboard app and only can test keyboard installation flow.
- http://mpizza.github.io/ime/install.html.
objects.name: [Keyboard][Uninstallation] Cannot remove third party keyboard from home screen

steps.instruction: Install a third party keyboards on Marketplace, then enable it on keyboard settings
Launch the message app and use the third party keyboard (Tap text field)
Press home button after third party keyboard pop up

steps.expected: User cannot delete third party keyboard from home screen since the icon of keyboard shouldn't show on home screen
steps.instruction: Look for third party keyboard icon

tags.description:
If this is the "Keyboard" test suite, you should have the "UI Test App".  Install it as follows:

1. Connect to the internet on your phone via WiFi or Data. 
2. Go to http://mozqa.com/webapi-permissions-tests/ in your B2G Browser.
3. scroll down to "Packaged App Test Case 13"
4. Click "Install Packaged App" button on the page.
5. The "UI Test" app should appear on your homescreen.

(Please disregard this step if this is "Keyboard & Text Handling" or any other suite).
tags.name: keyboard

objects.description:
User can make device enter ECM mode after dial out an emergency call even with no UIM card inserted.

Prerequisite: 1. For CDMA phone only, make sure you have CDMA account under CDMA network. 2. Emergency call number are varied in different country, please test with correct number for your local CDMA account.
objects.name: [CDMA] User can enter Emergency Callback Mode (ECM) on device (without UIM)

steps.instruction: Remove UIM card.

steps.expected: Call can be established.
steps.instruction: Dial local emergency number from DUT. (ex: 911, 112)

steps.expected: There is a notification underneath status bar to indicate emergency call back mode and the remaining time of it.
steps.instruction: End the call when call is connected.

objects.description:
User can make device enter ECM mode after dial out an emergency call even under airplane mode

Prerequisite: 1. For CDMA phone only, make sure you have CDMA account under CDMA network. 2. Emergency call number are varied in different country, please test with correct number for your local CDMA account.
objects.name: [CDMA] User can enter Emergency Callback Mode (ECM) on device (airplane mode on)

steps.instruction: Enable airplane mode.

steps.expected: 1. Airplane mode is off automatically. 2. Call can be dialled out and connected.
steps.instruction: Dial local emergency number from DUT. (ex: 911, 112)

steps.expected: 1. There is a notification underneath status bar to indicate emergency call back mode and the remaining time of it. 2. Data is not connected.
steps.instruction: End the call after call is connected.

bug 880960; 
Part of it is to check the dialogs and making sure things work ok.  I also checked the check in.

objects.description:
After unlock UIM PIN code, data call should be connected.

Prerequisite: 
1. For CDMA phone only, make sure you have CDMA account under CDMA network.
2. Data call is enabled.
objects.name: [CDMA]  User should be able to use data connection after unlock UIM PIN code

steps.instruction: Enable UIM PIN lock under Settings > SIM security.

steps.expected: UIM PIN code requiring page will show. Device cannot camp on network yet.
steps.instruction: Turn on airplane mode and then turn it off.

steps.expected: Device will camp on network and established data call.
steps.instruction: Input correct PIN code.

objects.description:
* Precondition:
* Setup your build according to  https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/Firefox\_OS/Developing\_Gaia/Market\_customizations\_guide
* https://wiki.mozilla.org/B2G/QA/Customizations#Note

* User Story:
* As an OEM, I want to be able to specify which bookmarks should be shown by default on the device based on the MNC/MCC setting from the SIM card inserted during the First Run Experience or when the SIM card is inserted for the first time in order to target customizations to locales without needing to use separate builds.

* Reference Information:
* MCC/MNC Definition - http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mobile\_country\_code
objects.name: [Customized] Preload Bookmarks w/o default Bookmark and w/o SIM card inserted

steps.expected: Then there should be no bookmarks seen
steps.instruction: When I check the bookmarks on the homescreen

objects.description:
* Precondition:
* 1. You'll need a T-Mobile US SIM & AT&T US SIM (or 2 SIM cards from 2 different operators)
* 2. Include your T-Mobile US SIM in your device (First SIM)
* 3. Setup your build according to https://wiki.mozilla.org/B2G/QA/Customizations#Build\_Setup

* User Story:
* As an OEM, I want to be able to specify which contacts should be preloaded on the device based on the MNC/MCC setting from the SIM card inserted during the First Run Experience in order to target customizations to locales without needing to use separate builds.

* http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mobile_country_code
* https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/Firefox\_OS/Developing\_Gaia/Market\_customizations\_guide
* https://wiki.mozilla.org/B2G/QA/Customizations#Note
objects.name: [Customized] Preload Contacts with SIM inserted during FTE

steps.expected: Then I should see a single contact included called 310260 Person(or the contact for first SIM) - no other contacts included
steps.instruction:
Include your T-Mobile US SIM in your device (or First SIM)
When I check the contacts preloaded in the contacts app

steps.expected: Then I should see a single contact included called 310260 Person only (or the contact for first SIM) - no other contacts included
steps.instruction: When I power down my device, change the SIM to the AT&T US (or 2nd specified) SIM, power on the device, and go to the contacts app

objects.description:
* User Story:
* As an OEM, I want to be able to specify which contacts should be preloaded on the device based on the MNC/MCC setting from the SIM card inserted during the First Run Experience in order to target customizations to locales without needing to use separate builds.

* Edit customization/variant.json & customization/mobizilla/mobizilla_contacts.json - for sim specific customization (by MNC/MCC)

* http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mobile_country_code
* https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/Firefox\_OS/Developing\_Gaia/Market\_customizations\_guide
* https://wiki.mozilla.org/B2G/QA/Customizations#Note
objects.name: [Customized] Preload Contacts w/ default Contacts and w/o SIM card inserted during FTE

steps.expected: Then I should see two preloaded contacts titled test 1 & test 2 included - no other contacts present
steps.instruction: When I launch the contacts app & check the preloaded contacts

steps.expected: Then I should see two preloaded contacts titled test 1 & test 2 included - no other contacts present
steps.instruction: When I power off the device, insert a specified SIM, power it on, and launch the contacts app & check preloaded contacts

objects.description:
History: 
* Changed from Browser to Rocketbar
* Bug 840210 
Prereq: Turn WiFi on
objects.name: [Browser] Use no SIM card and search

steps.instruction: remove SIM from the phone

steps.expected: phone should still turn on, SIM card missing symbol should appear in the upper right corner
steps.instruction: turn phone on

steps.expected: Rocket bar should change the UI
steps.instruction: tap in the Rocketbar

steps.expected: Search using the default search engine should appear
steps.instruction: type something in the URL bar that is not a web page ie "Yomiuri"

* https://wiki.mozilla.org/B2G/QA/Customizations#Note

Compile and push gaia onto the device
once the SIM is placed; turn the device on

steps.expected: Search within the specified search engine from step 1 should occur

objects.description:
* changed to Rocketbar in v1.4; bookmarks are icons on the homepage.
Bug 840210 : 1.3 to 1.4 browser database testing
objects.name: [Browser] Browser OTA Testing

steps.instruction: flash previous version to the test run version (ex 1.3 for the time that this test case was written) on the device
launch browser
go to several sites and bookmark them

steps.expected: This should change the channel to 1.3 for the device used
steps.instruction: use the appropriate script to change the channel to 1.3

steps.expected: after a couple of minutes a notification should appear asking to update
steps.instruction: reboot the phone, go to settings -> device information -> check for updates

steps.expected: should then be on 1.4 nightly; double check by checking the settings -> device information -> more information
steps.instruction: pull down the notification and update then reboot

steps.expected: there should be icons for each bookmark
steps.instruction: look at the home page

steps.expected: the top sites and history should be listed the same in the appropriate locations
steps.instruction: tap on the rocketbar

objects.description:
* Precondition:
* 1. You'll need a T-Mobile US SIM & AT&T US SIM (2 SIM cards from 2 different operators)
* 2. Include your T-Mobile US SIM in your device (First SIM)
* 3. Setup your build according to https://wiki.mozilla.org/B2G/QA/Customizations#Build\_Setup

* User Story:
* As an OEM, I want to be able to specify which support contacts (under Settings>Help) should be used on the device based on the MNC/MCC setting from the SIM card inserted during the First Run Experience in order to target customizations to locales without needing to use separate builds. 

* https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/Firefox\_OS/Developing\_Gaia/Market\_customizations\_guide
* https://wiki.mozilla.org/B2G/QA/Customizations#Note
* http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mobile\_country\_code
objects.name: [Customized] Preloaded Support Contacts with SIM inserted during FTE

steps.expected: Then I should see an online support link titled Google and two call support links that say - Dial 3102601 & Dial 3102602call (any number specified in variant.json)
steps.instruction: When I launch the settings app and go to help

steps.expected: Then the online support link should load http://www.google.com in the browser
steps.instruction: When I select the online support link

steps.expected: Then the dialer app should open with 3102601 preloaded as the dialed number
steps.instruction: When I go back to the settings app in help & select Dial 3102601

steps.expected: Then the dialer app should open with 3102602 preloaded as the dialed number
steps.instruction: When I go back to the settings app in help & select Dial 3102602call

steps.expected: Then I should see an online support link titled Google and two call support links that say - Dial 3102601 & Dial 3102602call
steps.instruction: When I power down my device, change the SIM to the AT&T US SIM(2nd SIM), power on the device, and go to the settings app in help

objects.description: As a user, i would like to ensure the GPS turns off after map application is terminated. Thus, no extra power will consume.
objects.name: GPS should be turn off after map applicaiton is terminated such as here maps

steps.instruction: From the home screen navigate left to the E.me page

steps.expected: Categories will appear
steps.instruction: Tap the "Search" field

steps.expected: Different apps will appear on the screen
steps.instruction:
Type "Here Maps" and search
(or Navigate to the "Local" category, it's not guaranteed that you see the app)

steps.expected: GPS "target" icon will appear in the notification bar
steps.instruction: Open the "Here Maps" app and allow the application to know your location by pressing "Allow" on the prompt message

steps.expected: The GPS icon will gray out and then will disapear
steps.instruction: Tap the "Home"  key button to exit the "Here Maps" app

objects.description:
Users can exit emergency callback mode through the confirm window triggered by sending SMS.

Prerequisite:
1. For CDMA phone only, make sure you have CDMA account under CDMA network.
2. Emergency call number are varied in different country, please test with correct number for your local CDMA account.
objects.name: [CDMA] User can exit Emergency Callback Mode (ECM) through confirm window after sending SMS

steps.expected: 1. There is a notification underneath status bar to indicate emergency call back mode and the remaining time of it. 2. Data will be disconnected.
steps.instruction: Dial local emergency number from DUT. (ex: 911, 112) End the call when call is connected.

steps.expected: A confirm window pops out with description and countdown timer demonstrate ECM.
steps.instruction: Compose a SMS and press send button.

steps.expected: ECM mode will be cancelled and message will be sent.
steps.instruction: Select ok on the confirm window.

steps.expected: Make sure data call can be accessed and SMS can be received without being blocked by ECM mode.
steps.instruction: Checking data call and receiving SMS.

objects.description:
Users can exit emergency callback mode through the confirm window triggered by accessing data call.

Prerequisite:
1. For CDMA phone only, make sure you have CDMA account under CDMA network.
2. Emergency call number are varied in different country, please test with correct number for your local CDMA account.
objects.name: [CDMA] User can exit Emergency Callback Mode (ECM) through confirm window when trying to use data call

steps.expected: 1. There is a notification underneath status bar to indicate emergency call back mode and the remaining time of it. 2. Data will be disconnected.
steps.instruction: Dial local emergency number from DUT. (ex: 911, 112) End the call when call is connected.

steps.expected: A confirm window pops out with description and countdown timer demonstrate ECM.
steps.instruction: Open browser and try to load a website.

steps.expected: ECM mode will be cancelled and website can be loaded.
steps.instruction: Select ok on the confirm window.

steps.expected: Make sure SMS can be working without being blocked by ECM mode.
steps.instruction: Sending and receiving SMS.

objects.description:

Prerequisite: Must have at least 1 WAV file already on the device or on a desktop machine or laptop. (If you already have an WAV music file on your device, then skip to Step 5.)

steps.expected: Music encoded with audio format WAV should play in the music app.

"Top-up completed X added"

objects.description: The aim of this test case is to verify if data usage graph is correct when a weekly billing period is selected.
objects.name: Verify the format of the graph is correct for weekly billing period

steps.expected:
The graph grid should be divided horizontally in 6 "squares" with seven lines, each line representing each day of the week.

Starting on a specific day of a week user has selected, the app takes day of week and based on current date transforms it into real dates.
steps.instruction: Once cost control FTE is completed and weekly period is selected, open data usage details view.

objects.description:
When there is no signal, device cannot send or receive SMS.

Prerequisite: 1. For CDMA phone only, make sure you have CDMA account under CDMA network. 2. Test may require no service environment such as shielding box, bag or room or a no signal area.
objects.name: [CDMA] Sending and receiving SMS under no service condition

steps.expected: No signal level can be seen on status bar.
steps.instruction: Take device to no service environment.

steps.expected: Unable to send out the message.
steps.instruction: Send a SMS to other account.

steps.expected: Unable to receive the message.
steps.instruction: Send a SMS to DUT.

steps.expected: DUT will receive SMS sent in step 3.
steps.instruction: Back to area with network coverage.

objects.description: The aim of this test case is to verify if the format of the data usage graph is correct when a monthly billing period is selected
objects.name: Verify the format of the graph is correct for monthly billing period

steps.expected:
Graph is divided horizontally in 30 "squares" with 31 lines each representing a day.
Dates behaviour is better explained in another test but, start and end date should be shown in the left down and right down sides respectively and today date just down below the dot representing today.
steps.instruction: Once cost control FTE is completed and monthly billing period selected, open data usage details view

objects.description:
Handoff between EVDO and Wifi are smoothly that each connection can be established when another one is off.

Prerequisite:
1. For CDMA phone only. Make sure test under EVDO network.
2. Set Cellular & Data > Network operator > Network type setting to "CDMA/EVDO".
objects.name: [CDMA] EVDO and Wifi handoff test

steps.expected: Ev icon is on signal bar.
steps.instruction: Data call is turned on.

steps.expected: Wifi connection will be established and become main internet connection, Ev icon will be replaced by Wifi icon.
steps.instruction: Turn on DUT wifi and connect to a AP.

steps.expected: Once Wifi connection is off, Ev data call will be established right away.
steps.instruction: Turn off Wifi AP or make DUT out of its coverage.

steps.expected: Ev data call is working, no data stall.
steps.instruction: Browser websites or access other data services.

steps.expected: Wifi connection will replace Ev data call again.
steps.instruction: Turn on Wifi AP or bring DUT back in AP's coverage.

steps.expected: Wifi connection is working.
steps.instruction: Browser websites or access other data services.

steps.expected: Ev data and wifi can switch and function correctly.
steps.instruction: Repeat handoff step 3 to 5 several times.

objects.description: The aim of this test case is to verify that the format of the data usage graph is correct when never billing period is selected.
objects.name: Verify the format of the graph is correct for never billing period

steps.expected:
When Never is selected as reset report period, (from first time) it starts at 0 at very left, with month reset graph. Today date continues until day 21 on the chart, then stops... and only the dates on the bottom changes everytime the date changes.
- Never reset from mid period (before day 21):
If Never is selected as reset report period, and date is BEFORE day 21 of
monthly calendar.. graph stays the same. Usage continues until day 21 of monthly calendar, and then as days progress only the dates change on the month calendar axis and graph history disappears.
- Never reset from mid period (after day 21):
If Never is selected as reset report period, and date is AFTER day 21 of
monthly calendar, the graph shifts back to day 21 point of month and dates change on axis.
steps.instruction: Once cost control FTE is completed and never billing period is selected, open data usage details view

objects.description:
User can send and receive SMS in EV network only even there is 1x network coverage by selecting "EVDO" in Network Type.

Prerequisite:
1. For CDMA phone only.
2. Make sure you have CDMA account.
3. Make sure you are in 1xRTT and EVDO network coverage. (Or test with network emulator)
objects.name: [CDMA] Verify SMS function in "EVDO" only network mode

steps.instruction: Go to Settings > Cellular & Data > Network Operator > Network type.

steps.expected: Ev icon will be on status bar.
steps.instruction: Select "EVDO".

steps.expected: Unable to send the message. (For some carrier, send out message is available, this is done by modem, so depends on the partner phone design).
steps.instruction: Send a SMS to other device.

steps.expected: Unable to receive SMS in EVDO only mode.
steps.instruction: Send a SMS to DUT.

objects.description:

objects.description: As a user, I want to be able to change my active keyboard from anywhere in the OS, so I can change keyboards quickly and reliably and am never locked into using one keyboard.
objects.name: [Keyboard][Interactive][Performance] User can quick switch keyboard

launch the message app and tap text filed to use keyboard

steps.expected:
1. User can quick switch keyboard via global key
2. If FxOS switches the keyboard from default to third party keyboard, the default keyboard will be hidden first then display the third party keyboard, vice versa.
steps.instruction: After keyboard pops up, quick tapping global key to switch keyboard

tags.description:
If this is the "Keyboard" test suite, you should have the "UI Test App".  Install it as follows:

1. Connect to the internet on your phone via WiFi or Data. 
2. Go to http://mozqa.com/webapi-permissions-tests/ in your B2G Browser.
3. scroll down to "Packaged App Test Case 13"
4. Click "Install Packaged App" button on the page.
5. The "UI Test" app should appear on your homescreen.

(Please disregard this step if this is "Keyboard & Text Handling" or any other suite).

objects.description:
User should be able to  close SI message.

Prerequisite: Using NowSMS(http://www.nowsms.com/) to send WAP Push messages to device.
objects.name: [WAP Push] Exiting an opened SI message by close button

steps.instruction: Enable WAP Push in  Settings > Call setting.

steps.expected:
1. Audible notification sound will be heard.
2. A WAP push message notification can be seen on top bar.
steps.instruction: Send a WAP Push message from NowSMS with text, WAP URL and SI push type values filled and selected on the software.

steps.expected: WAP Push message window will be opened with identical content sent in previous step.
steps.instruction: Scroll down notification bar and tap the received message.

steps.expected: Message will be closed and not saved in Message app or stay in notification bar.
steps.instruction: Tap the close icon on top left of the window.

objects.description:
User should be able to  close SI messages one by one.

Prerequisite: Using NowSMS(http://www.nowsms.com/) to send WAP Push messages to device.
objects.name: [WAP Push] Exiting multiple SI message by close button

steps.instruction: Enable WAP Push in  Settings > Call setting.

steps.expected:
1. Audible notification sound will be heard.
2. WAP push message notifications can be seen on top bar.
steps.instruction: Send more than 3 WAP Push messages from NowSMS with text,different  WAP URL and SI push type values filled and selected on the software.

steps.expected: WAP Push message window will be opened with identical content sent in previous step.
steps.instruction: Scroll down notification bar and tap a received message.

steps.expected: Message will be closed and not saved in Message app or stay in notification bar.
steps.instruction: Tap the close icon on top left of the window.

steps.expected: All messages can be closed without problems.
steps.instruction: Repeat step 4 until all messages are closed.

objects.description:
As a user, when I exit the music application while the music is still playing I want to see an icon on the status bar indicating that music is still being played while the home screen is still unlocked

Reference: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=891014

Automated via marionette/Player-test.js
objects.name: [Music] Controls: Verify Icon Displays in the status bar while music is still playing

steps.expected: A set of controls show at the bottom of the screen.
steps.instruction: Open the Music app and select a track to play from the Music Home screen.

steps.expected: The track should start playing and you should see a pause button render in the UI.
steps.instruction: Press the Play button to begin playing the track.

steps.expected: The Play icon should be visible in the status bar.
steps.instruction: Press the Home button to return to the Home screen.

objects.description:
As a user, I want the option to disable email notifications but have emails continue to sync, so that I do not get annoyed with my hundreds of emails per day, but I can still open email and not need to wait until the list is refreshed. 

Precondition: 
1) Prepare a FxOS device, we called Phone-A
2) Prepare three email account, we called emailacc-1, emailacc-2, and emailacc-3
3) No email account is set into email app.
objects.name: [Email][Notification] One of accounts' notification is disable

steps.expected: After that, the email app is launched
steps.instruction: Tapping the email icon

Input account information(emailacc-1) on account creating page.
1) Your name
2) E-mail
3) Password

While you are done, tap the "Next" button of the upper right corner.

steps.expected: The e-mail account is set.
steps.instruction:
After you entered the next page, set the following information.
1) Check for new messages="5 minutes"
2) Display notifications for new messages="Enable"

Then tap the "Next" button of the upper right corner.
Set up account-2 by following step 2 and step 3 but set the "Display notifications for new messages" is "Disable"
Press power on button to enter sleep mode
Using emailacc-3 to send out a email to emailacc-1 and emailacc-2

steps.expected: Phone-A only displays notification of emailacc-1 on homescreen.
steps.instruction: After 5 minutes, press the power on button and check the notification of Phone-A

7. Tap on OK(ER5).

steps.expected: Bluetooth is turned on and the list of devices screen is shown
steps.instruction: Tap the Turn On button

steps.expected:
The pairing process is successful, the notification of the sending process is shown, 
and the recipient receives a file transfer request of the contact sent as vCard
steps.instruction: Select a device to pair

objects.description:
PREREQUISITES:
-----
* Bluetooth should be on. 
There should be contact in the contact list.
objects.name: Send a contact via bluetooth (Bluetooth is already on)

steps.instruction: Open Contacts app
Tap the Settings icon then Export Contacts

steps.expected: The Bluetooth devices screen is shown with the list of devices to pair
steps.instruction: Tap the Bluetooth button

steps.expected: The pairing process is successful.  The notification of the sending process is shown.  The recipient receives correctly the contact sent as vCard
steps.instruction: Select a device to pair

objects.description:
PREREQUISITES:
-----
* There should be more than two contacts in the address book fulfilling any of the matching rules. 
All the contacts suggested as duplicated have different pictures associated. 
The original contact does not have picture.
objects.name: Verify that when merging many suggested contacts with picture, the valid one would be the picture of the first contact, with picture, to be merged

steps.instruction: Open the address book
Select one contact without picture and open the details view

steps.expected: ER1. Contact fulfilling any of the matching rules with the contact's from where the 'Find duplicate contacts' was launch is suggested as duplicate.
steps.instruction: Tap on 'Find duplicate contacts' option (ER1)
Select the contact shown as suggested duplicate

steps.expected: ER2. The picture of the first contact to merge prevails and will be added to the original contact.
steps.instruction: Tap on merge (ER2)

objects.description:
PREREQUISITES:
-----
* There should be at least two contacts in the address book fulfilling any of the matching rules. 
Both the contact suggested as duplicated and the original have different pictures associated
objects.name: Verify that when merging if the suggested contact has a picture and also the original contact, then the picture is not overwritten

steps.expected:
ER1. Contact fulfilling any of the matching rules with the contact's from where the 'Find duplicate contacts' was launch is suggested as duplicate. 
ER2. When the picture that is associated to the contact from where the 'find and merge duplicate contacts' functionality was launched is different than the picture associated to a suggested contact that is merging, it is not added. 
The picture of the contacts from where the 'Find duplicate contacts' was launch prevails
steps.instruction:
1. Open the address book 
2. Select one contact with picture and open the details view 
3. Tap on 'Find duplicate contacts' option (ER1) 
4. Select the contact shown as suggested duplicate 
5. Tap on merge (ER2)

objects.description:
PREREQUISITES:
-----
* There should be at least two contacts in the address book fulfilling any of the matching rules. 
Only the contact suggested as duplicated have a picture associated
objects.name: Verify that when merging if the suggested contact has a picture and the original contact does not have, then the picture is added

steps.instruction: Open the address book
Select one contact without picture name and open the details view

steps.expected: ER1. Contact fulfilling any of the matching rules with the contact's from where the 'Find duplicate contacts' was launch is suggested as duplicate.
steps.instruction: Tap on 'Find duplicate contacts' option (ER1)
Select the contact shown as suggested duplicate

steps.expected: ER2. When the picture field that is associated to the contact from where the 'find and merge duplicate contacts' functionality was launched is empty, the picture associated to a suggested contact that is merging is added
steps.instruction: Tap on merge (ER2)

objects.description:
PREREQUISITES:
-----
* Create at least two contacts in the Contacts app with some matching information (name, email, phone number, etc.) but with different addresses.
objects.name: Verify that when a contact is merged with another  with different (or no) address, the correct label is saved with that address after merging.

steps.expected: The Contacts list is displayed.
steps.instruction: Open the Contacts app.

steps.expected: The selected contact's detail view is opened.
steps.instruction: Select a contact with a different address (or no address) that has other fields matching with another contact (name, email, phone number, etc.)

steps.expected: A list of possible duplicate contacts is displayed.
steps.instruction: Tap the "Find duplicate contacts" button.

steps.expected: The contacts are merged and an address has been added with the label it was originally created with (ie: Home, Work, or a custom tag set by the user.)
steps.instruction: Select the suggested contact and press the "Merge with 1 contact" button.

objects.description:
PREREQUISITES:
-----
* There should be at least two contacts in the address book fulfilling any of the matching rules. 
The contact that will be suggested as duplicate has an address in address field.
objects.name: Verify that when merging, if the suggested contact has an address then, it is added to the original contact

steps.instruction: Open the address book
Select one contact with (or without) address and open the details view

steps.expected: ER1. Contact fulfilling any of the matching rules with the contact's from where the 'Find duplicate contacts' was launch is suggested as duplicate.
steps.instruction: Tap on 'Find duplicate contacts' option (ER1)
Select the contact shown as suggested duplicate

steps.expected:
ER2. The address of the contact which is merging is added as a new address to the original contact. 
If the original contact did not have an address then there will be only one. 
If the original contact already had an address, then there will be two addresses available
steps.instruction: Tap on merge (ER2)

objects.description:

-----
* There should be at least two contacts in the address book fulfilling any of the matching rules. 
The contact that will be suggested as duplicate has text in comment field
objects.name: Verify that when merging, if the suggested contact has a comment then, it is added to the original contact

steps.instruction: Open the address book

steps.expected: ER1. Contact fulfilling any of the matching rules with the contact's from where the 'Find duplicate contacts' was launch is suggested as duplicate.
steps.instruction: Tap on 'Find duplicate contacts' option (ER1)
Select the contact shown as suggested duplicate

steps.expected: ER2. The comment of the contact which is merging is added as a new comment to the original contact.
steps.instruction: Tap on merge (ER2)

objects.description:
PREREQUISITES:
-----
* There should be at least two contacts in the address book fulfilling any of the matching rules. 
The contact suggested as duplicate has a different email, without type, than the contact from where the 'Find duplicates' is launch.
objects.name: Verify that when merging an email without type associated, a correct label is assigned

steps.instruction: 1. Open the address book
Select one contact with or without email and open the details view

steps.expected: ER1. Contact fulfilling any of the matching rules with the contact's from where the 'Find duplicate contacts' was launch is suggested as duplicate.
steps.instruction: Tap on 'Find duplicate contacts' option (ER1)
Select the contact shown as suggested duplicate

steps.expected:
ER2. When the email that is associated to the contact from where the 'find and merge duplicate contacts' functionality was launched is different (or empty), than the email associated to a suggested contact that is merging, it is added with a correct label. 
There should not appear 'null' or similar as its type
steps.instruction: Tap on merge (ER2)

objects.description:
PREREQUISITES:
-----
* There should be at least two contacts in the address book fulfilling any of the matching rules. 
The contact suggested as duplicate has the same email than the contact from where the 'Find duplicates' is launch
objects.name: Verify that when merging if the suggested contact's email is the same than the original contact's one, then it is discarded

steps.instruction: Open the address book
Select one contact with email and open the details view

steps.expected: ER1. Contact fulfilling any of the matching rules with the contact's from where the 'Find duplicate contacts' was launch is suggested as duplicate.
steps.instruction: Tap on 'Find duplicate contacts' option (ER1)
Select the contact shown as suggested duplicate

steps.expected:
ER2. When the email that is associated to the contact from where the 'find and merge duplicate contacts' functionality was launched is the same than the email associated to a suggested contact that is merging, then it is discarded. 
There should not be a duplicated entry with the same email.
steps.instruction: Tap on merge (ER2)
